chartbeat.title: Billie Eilish – ​my future Lyrics | Genius Lyrics

title: Billie Eilish – ​my future Lyrics | Genius Lyrics

body.html:
[Verse 1]
I can't seem to focus
And you don't seem to notice I'm not here
I'm just a mirror
You check your complexion
To find your reflection's all alone
I had to go

[Pre-Chorus]
Can't you hear me?
I'm not comin' home
Do you understand?
I've changed my plans

[Chorus]
'Cause I, I'm in love
With my future
Can't wait to meet her
And I (I), I'm in love
But not with anybody else
Just wanna get to know myself

[Verse 2]
I know supposedly I'm lonely now (Lonely now)
Know I'm supposed to be unhappy
Without someone (Someone)
But aren't I someone? (Aren't I someone? Yeah)
I'd (I'd) like to be your answer (Be your answer)
'Cause you're so handsome (You're so handsome)

[Pre-Chorus]
But I know better
Than to drive you home
'Cause you'd invite me in
And I'd be yours again

[Chorus]
But I (I), I'm in love (Love, love, love, love)
With my future
And you don't know her (Ooh)
And I, I'm in love (Love, love)
But not with anybody here
I'll see you in a couple years

pinned_questions.body: What have the artists said about the song?

body.html:
In an email sent to fans, Billie revealed:

we wrote this at the very beginning of quarantine. it’s a song that’s really really personal and special to me. when we wrote this song, it was exactly where my head was at – hopeful, excited and a craaaazy amount of self reflection and self growth. but recently it has also taken on a lot of new meaning in the context of what’s happening in the world now. i hope you can all find meaning in it for yourselves

In an Instagram post after the release of the song, Finneas stated:

The first thing we made during quarantine was “My Future”. I will forever cherish the rainy days I spent making this song with my sister. It’s been a scary year for so many reasons but I choose to be optimistic and so many of you make me feel so inspired about the future. Hope you enjoy this song♥️
body.markdown:
In an [email sent to fans](https://s3.amazonaws.com/filepicker-images-rapgenius/ANB6Dt25R1iwvFPsOb4J_Screen%20Shot%202020-07-30%20at%207.22.03%20PM.png), Billie revealed:

>we wrote this at the very beginning of quarantine. it’s a song that’s really really personal and special to me. when we wrote this song, it was exactly where my head was at - hopeful, excited and a craaaazy amount of self reflection and self growth. but recently it has also taken on a lot of new meaning in the context of what’s happening in the world now. i hope you can all find meaning in it for yourselves

In an [Instagram post](https://www.instagram.com/p/CDSVCwxFFCc/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link) after the release of the song, Finneas stated:

>The first thing we made during quarantine was “My Future”. I will forever cherish the rainy days I spent making this song with my sister. It’s been a scary year for so many reasons but I choose to be optimistic and so many of you make me feel so inspired about the future. Hope you enjoy this song♥️

pinned_questions.body: What has Billie said about the process of creating the song?

body.html:
In an interview with Zane Lowe, Billie revealed:

This was such a satisfying process. It was so, so satisfying. We wrote the song in like two days. Crazy fast for us. This is the most we’ve ever worked in one period of time. But we record, we wrote it like a month into quarantine probably. And it was pouring rain. We were in this like… Oh, it was such a perfect setting. And then we recorded the vocal in Finneas' studio, which is just in his basement in his house…. For me, I’m sure you know, I take fucking forever to get a vocal take that I like, and I do like a billion takes. And this one… I just, I don’t know, there was something about this one take that I did, and I was like, ‘This is the only way that it can be.’ You know what was funny? It was, we were kind of stuck for like a day. We were like, ‘What the fuck do we do here? What do we… where does this go?’ I was like, ‘I don’t think we’re going to get anything done.’ We had the song recorded, but we didn’t have, we didn’t know what to do with it. And we popped in the pool. We got out of the pool, and I was literally going to go home. And I was like, ‘Let’s just fuck around with it a little more.’ And we finished the song that night, like finished completely. It was crazy.
body.markdown:
In an [interview with Zane Lowe](https://music.apple.com/be/post/1525737617), Billie revealed:

> This was such a satisfying process. It was so, so satisfying. We wrote the song in like two days. Crazy fast for us. This is the most we've ever worked in one period of time. But we record, we wrote it like a month into quarantine probably. And it was pouring rain. We were in this like... Oh, it was such a perfect setting. And then we recorded the vocal in Finneas' studio, which is just in his basement in his house.... For me, I'm sure you know, I take fucking forever to get a vocal take that I like, and I do like a billion takes. And this one... I just, I don't know, there was something about this one take that I did, and I was like, 'This is the only way that it can be.' You know what was funny? It was, we were kind of stuck for like a day. We were like, 'What the fuck do we do here? What do we... where does this go?' I was like, 'I don't think we're going to get anything done.' We had the song recorded, but we didn't have, we didn't know what to do with it. And we popped in the pool. We got out of the pool, and I was literally going to go home. And I was like, 'Let's just fuck around with it a little more.' And we finished the song that night, like finished completely. It was crazy.

pinned_questions.body: What else have the artists said about the song?

body.html:
I spent years and years relying on having someone—I could never be alone. It’s not something you’d think about being hard. But when you’re in that alone zone, it’s a new feeling. I feel like people—everything is about love. There’s nothing that talks about how being alone is really powerful.

–Billie Eilish via Apple Music
body.markdown:
> I spent years and years relying on having someone---I could never be alone. It's not something you'd think about being hard. But when you're in that alone zone, it's a new feeling. I feel like people---everything is about love. There's nothing that talks about how being alone is really powerful.

--Billie Eilish [via Apple Music](https://archive.org/details/billie-my-future)

preloaded_referents.twitter_share_message: “In the chorus, Billie sings about her enthusiasm for the future and what it has in store for her…” —@Genius

body.html:
In the chorus, Billie sings about her enthusiasm for the future and what it has in store for her. Billie explained further in an email sent to fans:

when we wrote this song, it was exactly where my head was at – hopeful, excited and a craaaazy amount of self reflection and self growth. but recently it has also taken on a lot of new meaning in the context of what’s happening in the world now

The COVID-19 pandemic, also known as the coronavirus pandemic, has impacted countless lives worldwide and caused uncertainty for the future. Billie acknowledges these fears, but she instead chooses to have a more optimistic view of the future. In the email she sent to her fans after the release of “my future,” Billie spoke about maintaining her optimism:

the future feels uncertain and crazy right now. but i think we need to be ready to put the work in, and if we do that, we should be hopeful and excited for our future. i have to keep reminding myself that the future is ours, and i know we want to do everything we can to make it better for everyone in the world. and for the world itself… it’s up to us to change things now. not only for us, but for future generations. stay hopeful.

In a July 2020 interview with Zane Lowe, Billie explained the final line of the song:

There’s still hope in it. We will get out of this eventually. It might take years, but we’ll be okay eventually.
body.plain:
In the chorus, Billie sings about her enthusiasm for the future and what it has in store for her. Billie explained further in an email sent to fans:

when we wrote this song, it was exactly where my head was at – hopeful, excited and a craaaazy amount of self reflection and self growth. but recently it has also taken on a lot of new meaning in the context of what’s happening in the world now

The COVID-19 pandemic, also known as the coronavirus pandemic, has impacted countless lives worldwide and caused uncertainty for the future. Billie acknowledges these fears, but she instead chooses to have a more optimistic view of the future. In the email she sent to her fans after the release of “my future,” Billie spoke about maintaining her optimism:

the future feels uncertain and crazy right now. but i think we need to be ready to put the work in, and if we do that, we should be hopeful and excited for our future. i have to keep reminding myself that the future is ours, and i know we want to do everything we can to make it better for everyone in the world. and for the world itself… it’s up to us to change things now. not only for us, but for future generations. stay hopeful.

In a July 2020 interview with Zane Lowe, Billie explained the final line of the song:

There’s still hope in it. We will get out of this eventually. It might take years, but we’ll be okay eventually.
body.markdown:
In the chorus, Billie sings about her enthusiasm for the future and what it has in store for her. Billie explained further in an [email sent to fans](https://s3.amazonaws.com/filepicker-images-rapgenius/ANB6Dt25R1iwvFPsOb4J_Screen%20Shot%202020-07-30%20at%207.22.03%20PM.png):

>when we wrote this song, it was exactly where my head was at – hopeful, excited and a craaaazy amount of self reflection and self growth. but recently it has also taken on a lot of new meaning in the context of what's happening in the world now

The [COVID-19 pandemic](https://thepathologist.com/subspecialties/the-covid-19-pandemic-a-summary), also known as the coronavirus pandemic, has impacted countless lives worldwide and caused uncertainty for the future. Billie acknowledges these fears, but she instead chooses to have a more optimistic view of the future. In the [email](https://s3.amazonaws.com/filepicker-images-rapgenius/ANB6Dt25R1iwvFPsOb4J_Screen%20Shot%202020-07-30%20at%207.22.03%20PM.png) she sent to her fans after the release of "my future," Billie spoke about maintaining her optimism:

>the future feels uncertain and crazy right now. but i think we need to be ready to put the work in, and if we do that, we should be hopeful and excited for our future. i have to keep reminding myself that the future is ours, and i know we want to do everything we can to make it better for everyone in the world. and for the world itself... it's up to us to change things now. not only for us, but for future generations. stay hopeful.

In a July 2020 [interview with Zane Lowe](https://music.apple.com/be/post/1525737617), Billie explained the final line of the song:

>There's still hope in it. We will get out of this eventually. It might take years, but we'll be okay eventually.

appearance.label: news
appearance.title: Billie Eilish Drops New Song “My Future”

description.html:
“my future” portrays Billie reflecting on her past and her future, and her change in style from a more melancholic sound, towards a happier, more optimistic one. The track is Billie Eilish’s first single since the release of her acclaimed February 2020 James Bond theme song “No Time To Die.”

After almost a month away from social media, Eilish returned on July 24, 2020, to announce the track and its release date. The cover art and exact time of release for the song were announced later on July 28, 2020.

On July 29, a day before the release date, a snippet of the song was published on Billie’s Instagram page.

The track was released alongside a music video on July 30.
description.markdown:
"my future" portrays Billie reflecting on her past and her future, and her change in style from a more melancholic sound, towards a happier, more optimistic one. The track is Billie Eilish's first single since the release of her acclaimed February 2020 James Bond theme song ["No Time To Die."](https://genius.com/Billie-eilish-no-time-to-die-lyrics)

After almost a month away from social media, Eilish returned on July 24, 2020, to [announce the track](https://www.instagram.com/p/CDCORx5lVzA/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link) and its release date. The cover art and exact time of release for the song were [announced later](https://www.instagram.com/p/CDMek-6lSyy/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link) on July 28, 2020.

On July 29, a day before the release date, a [snippet](https://www.instagram.com/p/CDPIvcZlhBJ/) of the song was published on Billie's Instagram page.

The track was released alongside a [music video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dm9Zf1WYQ_A) on July 30.

song.description_preview:
“my future” portrays Billie reflecting on her past and her future, and her change in style from a more melancholic sound, towards a happier, more optimistic one. The track is Billie Eilish’s first single since the release of her acclaimed February 2020 James Bond theme song “No Time To Die.”

After almost a month away from social media, Eilish returned on July 24, 2020, to announce the track and its release date. The cover art and exact time of release for the song were announced later on July 28, 2020.

On July 29, a day before the release date, a snippet of the song was published on Billie’s Instagram page.

The track was released alongside a music video on July 30.
song.embed_content: Read “​my future” by Billie Eilish on Genius
song.title: ​my future

body.html:
“my future” portrays Billie reflecting on her past and her future, and her change in style from a more melancholic sound, towards a happier, more optimistic one. The track is Billie Eilish’s first single since the release of her acclaimed February 2020 James Bond theme song “No Time To Die.”

After almost a month away from social media, Eilish returned on July 24, 2020, to announce the track and its release date. The cover art and exact time of release for the song were announced later on July 28, 2020.

On July 29, a day before the release date, a snippet of the song was published on Billie’s Instagram page.

The track was released alongside a music video on July 30.
body.markdown:
"my future" portrays Billie reflecting on her past and her future, and her change in style from a more melancholic sound, towards a happier, more optimistic one. The track is Billie Eilish's first single since the release of her acclaimed February 2020 James Bond theme song ["No Time To Die."](https://genius.com/Billie-eilish-no-time-to-die-lyrics)

After almost a month away from social media, Eilish returned on July 24, 2020, to [announce the track](https://www.instagram.com/p/CDCORx5lVzA/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link) and its release date. The cover art and exact time of release for the song were [announced later](https://www.instagram.com/p/CDMek-6lSyy/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link) on July 28, 2020.

On July 29, a day before the release date, a [snippet](https://www.instagram.com/p/CDPIvcZlhBJ/) of the song was published on Billie's Instagram page.

The track was released alongside a [music video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dm9Zf1WYQ_A) on July 30.

― Billie Eilish – ​my future

body.html: My Future is from the perspective of the girl in the mirror from Idontwannabeyouanymore. The girl in the mirror is no longer depressed and since thats all the other Billie expects to see in the mirror she no longer sees her anymore. It’s a message to her old self and her audience that she is moving on into a new happier place.
body.markdown: My Future is from the perspective of the girl in the mirror from  Idontwannabeyouanymore. The girl in the mirror is no longer depressed and since thats all the other Billie expects to see in the mirror she no longer sees her anymore. It's a message to her old self and her audience that she is moving on into a new happier place.
